Description: What is data science? What kind of work do data scientists do? How are data products made? What is the data science pipeline?
Topics Covered: Data Science, Data Products, Data Science Pipeline

Instructor(s): Rebecca Bilbro, Pri Oberoi, Sasan Bahadaran
Description: Learn to work effectively on a data team and never lose your project again! Introduction to version control using Git software and the GitHub website.
Software Needed: Git, GitHub, Sublime or Atom.io, Terminal or Powershell

Description: Learn basic syntax and how to get up running with Python 2.7.
Topics Covered: Basic Syntax, List Comprehension, Packages, Looping, Pickling, Package Installation, Package Importing
Software Needed: Git, GitHub, Python, Sublime or Atom.io, Terminal or Powershell

Description: Learn the basic principles and concepts of design such as color theory, typography, branding, user experience design, and mobile design. Practice what you learn in photoshop, and walk away with a design by the end of the class.
Topics Covered: Design Principles, Color Theory, Adobe Programs and their uses, PhotoShop, UX Design, Mobile Design

Description: Introductory course that covers basic R syntax, input and output, and basic statistical analysis
Topics Covered: RStudio, Basic Syntax, Data Frames, Loading and Writing Data, Summary Statistics, Regression

Course Name: Intro to Data Analysis with R
Recommended Prerequisite(s): Intro to Data Science, Intro to R
Description: Given a dataset online, use R to load the data, compute summary statistics, and investigate correlations.
Topics Covered: Data Loading using R, Summary Statistics, Investigative Correlations
Software Needed: Git, GitHub, Terminal or Powershell, R, RStudio, Sublime or Atom.io

Description: Overview of internal R data visualization tools as well as use of Shiny, Leaflet, and Plotly for interactive visualizations.
Topics Covered: GGPlot2, Shiny, Plotly, Leaflet, RMarkDown, RStudio
Software Needed: Git, GitHub, Terminal or Powershell, R, RStudio, Sublime or Atom.io, GGPlot2, Shiny, Plotly, Leaflet, RMarkDown

Description: Download, explore, and wrangle the Titanic passenger manifest dataset with an eye toward developing a predictive model for survival
Software Needed: Git, GitHub, Python, Sublime or Atom.io, Terminal or Powershell

Recommended Prerequisite(s): Intro to Python, Data Wrangling with Pandas
Description: Basic introduction to machine learning: what it is, how it works, and how to get started with machine learning in Python using the Scikit-learn API.
Topics Covered: Supervised Learning, Unsupervised Learning, Scikit-Learn, Dimensionality Reduction, Preprocessing
Software Needed: Git, GitHub, Python, Sublime or Atom.io, Terminal or Powershell
Chrome Browser with Postman extension, Python, Sublime or Atom.io

Instructor(s): Natassja Linzau and Mark Brown II
Description: Introductory course that covers basic JS concepts and makes use of free online tools for programming in JS with real-life examples.
Topics Covered: Strings, Integers, Floats, and Equality; Loops, Methods, Functions, jQuery, Classes, and Objects

Description: Anscombe's quartet teaches us that data visualizations have a lot more utility than in just presenting results at the end of a project -- visual analytics can play a critical role in many phases of the data science pipeline, from analysis to wrangling to machine learning. Learn how you can deploy easy visualization tools in Python to boost your analytical power and get better results.
Topics Covered: Data Science Pipeline, Data Analysis, Data Wrangling, Machine Learning, Data Visualization
Software Needed: Git, GitHub, Python, Sublime or Atom.io, Terminal or Powershell

Recommended Prerequisite(s): Intro to Python, Intro to Git and Github

Course Name: Basic Data Ingestion with requests and beautifulsoup
